added_lines: # Copyright 2014 IBM Corp. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from nova.api.openstack import api_version_request from nova import exception from nova import test class APIVersionRequestTests(test.NoDBTestCase): def test_valid_version_strings(self): def _test_string(version, exp_major, exp_minor): v = api_version_request.APIVersionRequest(version) self.assertEqual(v.ver_major, exp_major) self.assertEqual(v.ver_minor, exp_minor) _test_string("1.1", 1, 1) _test_string("2.10", 2, 10) _test_string("5.234", 5, 234) _test_string(" 5.234", 5, 234) _test_string("12.5", 12, 5) _test_string(" 5.234 ", 5, 234) def test_null_version(self): v = api_version_request.APIVersionRequest() self.assertTrue(v.is_null()) def test_invalid_version_strings(self): self.assertRaises(exception.InvalidAPIVersionString, api_version_request.APIVersionRequest, "2") self.assertRaises(exception.InvalidAPIVersionString, api_version_request.APIVersionRequest, "200") self.assertRaises(exception.InvalidAPIVersionString, api_version_request.APIVersionRequest, "2.1.4") self.assertRaises(exception.InvalidAPIVersionString, api_version_request.APIVersionRequest, "200.23.66.3") self.assertRaises(exception.InvalidAPIVersionString, api_version_request.APIVersionRequest, "5 .3") self.assertRaises(exception.InvalidAPIVersionString, api_version_request.APIVersionRequest, "5. 3") self.assertRaises(exception.InvalidAPIVersionString, api_version_request.APIVersionRequest, "") def test_version_comparisons(self): v1 = api_version_request.APIVersionRequest("2.0") v2 = api_version_request.APIVersionRequest("2.5") v3 = api_version_request.APIVersionRequest("5.23") v4 = api_version_request.APIVersionRequest("2.0") v_null = api_version_request.APIVersionRequest() self.assertTrue(v1 < v2) self.assertTrue(v3 > v2) self.assertTrue(v1 != v2) self.assertTrue(v1 == v4) self.assertTrue(v1 != v_null) def test_version_matches(self): v1 = api_version_request.APIVersionRequest("2.0") v2 = api_version_request.APIVersionRequest("2.5") v3 = api_version_request.APIVersionRequest("2.45") v4 = api_version_request.APIVersionRequest("3.3") v5 = api_version_request.APIVersionRequest("3.23") v6 = api_version_request.APIVersionRequest("2.0") v7 = api_version_request.APIVersionRequest("3.3") v_null = api_version_request.APIVersionRequest() self.assertTrue(v2.matches(v1, v3)) self.assertTrue(v2.matches(v1, v_null)) self.assertTrue(v1.matches(v6, v2)) self.assertTrue(v4.matches(v2, v7)) self.assertFalse(v1.matches(v2, v3)) self.assertFalse(v5.matches(v2, v4)) self.assertFalse(v2.matches(v3, v1))

commit_message:
Drop RpcProxy usage from l2population code

This patch removes usage of the RpcProxy compatibility class from the
l2population code.  The equivalent oslo.messaging APIs are now used
instead.

Part of blueprint drop-rpc-compat.

Change-Id: Ie6d45f1871c2dba603bc17851b753bb960a9ca2b

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-11-20 11:59:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/6e5ff5eea632cc2ec6b9df2f1f1f237ff193d004', 'message': 'Defining the variable "tmp" before try block

commit_message:
Defining the variable "tmp" before try block

In file "image_utils.py", "tmp" variable initialized in try
block. So, if any exception occurred in the try block, then
"tmp" would not be assigned with any value. Because of this
finally block will raise an exception like "local variable
tmp tried to use before the assignment".

This patch resolves that issue by defining "tmp" variable before
try block.

Change-Id: I9d8c8eaaeba0a7aab7ebfc791b9ddd967f324184
Closes-Bug: #1394548

subject: Add doc8 a documentation style checking package
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-11-24 18:35:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/requirements/commit/7a7fb7c5ebc06bed9356e1c223dc36d7221f207a', 'message': "Add doc8 a documentation style checking package

Many of the projects are starting to do style checks
on there specs files or other rst files so it seems
appropriate to use a small utility library to do these
kinds of checks (to avoid repeated copied code).

Doc8 starts to create a path for a common rst documentation
checking suite that can avoid the 'test_titles.py' tests
that are appearing in the various specification repositories.

Projects that currently can benefit from this package:

- TaskFlow
- Cinder

commit_message:
Add doc8 a documentation style checking package

Many of the projects are starting to do style checks
on there specs files or other rst files so it seems
appropriate to use a small utility library to do these
kinds of checks (to avoid repeated copied code).

Doc8 starts to create a path for a common rst documentation
checking suite that can avoid the 'test_titles.py' tests
that are appearing in the various specification repositories.

Projects that currently can benefit from this package:

- TaskFlow
- Cinder
- Others with spec repos (nova, glance, oslo...)

This is cherry picked from 83b3a598558d1ce5 and is needed
so that libraries that have added doc8 to there testing
requirements can still function correctly (this is after all
just a testing requirement, so this should be harmless).

Change-Id: Ie942497d88ad4dc9a4b3e58bea213354ec5513c5

commit_message:
Install cloud-archive repository manually

Removed using the apt-add-repository tool due to differences in versions
and package names. Using this tool would require checking if the trusty-updates repository
was enabled and then an additional step to enable the repo if it wasn't enabled.

Change-Id: I325ad856cfd6a5acd72345da8631bd8be9617887
related-bug: 1350291
closes-bug: 1396460
backport: juno

commit_message:
Fix package name that adds apt-add-repository

Updated package name that provides apt-add-repository utility from
python-software-properties to software-properties-common

Also included a note about needing to pull software-properties-common from
the trusty-updates repository so that it includes cloud-archive:juno

Change-Id: If1c7c34950d39d477e1ebcb41a6a12287fac30b3
Related-Bug: 1350291
Closes-Bug: 1396460

The simple sample is used to show how to use `console_urls` attribute
of OS::Nova::Server resource.

Implements: blueprint vnc-console-attr
Co-Authored-By: Pavlo Shchelokovskyy <pshchelokovskyy@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Move API clients to better places

There are API tests for both JSON and XML, and basically we are
implementing JSON tests as the first priority. Then now the number
of XML tests is less than the one of the corresponding JSON tests.
XML tests depend on the existences of XML clients, but it is a little
difficult to know these existences because the setting clients are
not on readable order.

This patch moves these API clients to better places for the readability.
In addition, this patch removes internal methods which make clients
setting abstract because we have a plan for disabling all XML tests.

Change-Id: I628dc1196636c3de02eddf115f3f2a2351498509

commit_message:
Fix hostname regex pattern

Current hostname_pattern regex complexity grows exponentially
when given a string of just digits, which can be exploited to
cause neutron-server to freeze.

Change-Id: I886c6d883a9cb0acd9908495eec50bf0411d8ba8
Closes-bug: #1378450

commit_message:
Add a new greenio executor

The new executor is based on the EventletExecutor, but it supports
endpoints which are trollius coroutines.

Add an optional "executor_callback" in the __call__() method of
dispatchers, to be able to handle coroutines. The executor should behave
differently if the endpoint returns a trollius coroutine.

Implements: blueprint greenio-executor
Change-Id: Ib2c782e4495afd672890887f76e604bf287269dc

commit_message:
Recompiling Mellanox OFED drivers on Ubuntu nodes using dkms

Recompilation is needed since the drivers are compiled and
installed during Ubuntu installation on one kernel, but are
later used on a different kernel version.

Change-Id: I1fc4b7bf5603991a302e3ef145be57dd2f36e693
Closes-bug: 1396020
Signed-off-by: gilmeir <gilmeir@mellanox.com>

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-10-27 21:42:03.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/openstack/common/strutils.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer/commit/470ba0a26a8a15211639331d040812b47d745106', 'message': 'Sync strutils from oslo-incubator for mask_password fix

   1131b56 Enable mask_password to handle byte code strings

This is needed because Ceilometer commands are hitting the same
problem Cinder was hitting in bug 1368527 which was fixed
by this strutils update in bug 1366189.

This is not needed in kilo because in kilo Ceilometer has moved

Change-Id: I4aacbe8d44f0ae2a649294652a388fbd5e15b4c9

commit_message:
Sync strutils from oslo-incubator for mask_password fix

This sync pulls in:
   1131b56 Enable mask_password to handle byte code strings

This is needed because Ceilometer commands are hitting the same
problem Cinder was hitting in bug 1368527 which was fixed
by this strutils update in bug 1366189.

This is not needed in kilo because in kilo Ceilometer has moved
to using the oslo.utils library, which has this fix in it.

Closes-bug: #1366189
Change-Id: I4aacbe8d44f0ae2a649294652a388fbd5e15b4c9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/79/131279/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: try: message = six.text_type(message) except UnicodeDecodeError: # NOTE(jecarey): Temporary fix to handle cases where message is a # byte string. A better solution will be provided in Kilo. pass
deleted_lines: message = six.text_type(message)

commit_message:
Add benchmarks for murano

Add the the following benchmarks:
* Get list environments
* Create environment, create session, delete environment
* Deploy environment

Change-Id: Ib21c385adc21b3a078790f952ddd96cc4d3c55d5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/91/127491/29 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from muranoclient import client as murano def murano(self, version='1'): """Return Murano client.""" kc = self.keystone() murano_url = kc.service_catalog.url_for( service_type='application_catalog', endpoint_type=self.endpoint.endpoint_type, region_name=self.endpoint.region_name ) client = murano.Client(version, endpoint=murano_url, token=kc.auth_token) return client @cached

commit_message:
Renamed PublishErrorsHandler

For greater clarity, that the class is related to logging, PublishErrorsHandler
renamed to LoggingErrorNotificationHandler. Included an alias from the
old name to the new class for backwards-compatibility.

Change-Id: Iae8e26901bab6d5aa7532add31b49a4345b067fe
Closes-Bug: #1287420

commit_message:
Add external lock fixture

This was requested by consumers of the library so they don't have
to enable external locks globally with the OSLO_LOCK_PATH env var,
which can mask bugs in unit tests that have interdependencies
because it makes every lock in any unit test shared.  The new
fixture allows a separate lock directory to be created for each
test, and allows external locking to only be enabled for tests
that need it.

Change-Id: Iae7ce302e1a3a5ad90ca5310f5ac7a6164867637

subject: mask_password(bytes) now returns bytes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-11-27 11:09:10.000000000', 'files': ['oslo/utils/strutils.py', 'tests/test_strutils.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.utils/commit/8e840c467dc23aeabd76bd75e4b0f996cf33d932', 'message': 'mask_password(bytes) now returns bytes

If the input message is a bytes string, decode it from ISO-8859-1, but
also encode it back to bytes using the same encoding. This encoding
supports all bytes (0-255) and decoding from ISO-8859-1 never fails.

mask_password(bytes) must return bytes, not try to guess the input
encoding or fail badly if the bytes message contains non-ASCII bytes
(128-255).

Change-Id: I56401ae5c05d03d84c101601c326afa1d109bb55
'}]
commit_message:
mask_password(bytes) now returns bytes

If the input message is a bytes string, decode it from ISO-8859-1, but
also encode it back to bytes using the same encoding. This encoding
supports all bytes (0-255) and decoding from ISO-8859-1 never fails.

mask_password(bytes) must return bytes, not try to guess the input
encoding or fail badly if the bytes message contains non-ASCII bytes
(128-255).

Change-Id: I56401ae5c05d03d84c101601c326afa1d109bb55
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.utils refs/changes/00/137600/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add benchmark overview page to html report

The overview page shows all scenarios and their summarized results
in single table, so it is easier to understand the whole result
and compare specific scenarios.

Also, there are some minor features and fixes in html report.

Changes:
  * Benchmark overview page
  * Task input file is available now
  * Scenario full duration is added to overview
  * Scenario duration is renamed to `Load duration'
  * Overview is sortable
  * Fix: control from browser history: back/forward buttons now work
  * Fix: durations are reset for iterations with errors
  * AngularJS version is updated to release 1.3.3
  * task sla_check output: column `success' with options True/False
    is renamed to `status' with options PASS/FAIL

Change-Id: I0eb7af01432c9c10e4ec55720bb53417478a5789

added_lines: <para>Pacemaker requires both nodes should have the different hostnames. Because of that, RA scripts could require some adjustments since the Networking scheduler will be aware of one node, for example a virtual router attached to a single L3 node. E.g., both nodes could set diffrent hostname in /etc/sysconfig/network, and when l3-agent started by pacemaker, the node's hostname will be changed to network-controller automatically, so whichever node start the l3-agent, it's hostname would be the same</para>
deleted_lines: <para>Both nodes should have the same hostname since the Networking scheduler will be aware of one node, for example a virtual router attached to a single L3 node.</para>

commit_message:
Fixes for post-Juno world

Now that Juno has been released, there are some sections
in this guide that need to be updated.

This patch has a first hash of the "working with roadmaps"
appendix. It mainly focuses on getting things up to date
to around Juno Release. A later patch will add more forward-looking
statements toward Kilo.

In addition, a couple of small updates to the usecases chapter.

Change-Id: I2529072c0849467d98e39180cfdb07081e00dd02
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/operations-guide refs/changes/08/136808/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines:
the Kilo release and perhaps further afield. Kilo Kilo Under Development xlink:href="https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ReleaseNotes/Kilo">2015.1 Apr 30, 2015 Juno Current stable release, security-supported 2014.2 Oct 16, 2014 Icehouse Security-supported 2014.1.1 Jun 9, 2014 2014.1.2 Aug 8, 2014 2014.1.3 Oct 2, 2014 Havana End-of-life 2013.2.2 Feb 13, 2014 2013.2.3 Apr 3, 2014 2013.2.4 Sep 22, 2014 2013.2.1 Dec 16, 2013 Grizzly End-of-life 2013.1.5 Mar 20, 2015 End-of-life End-of-life Rough-draft design Havana and Icehouse), internal messaging communication is versioned, meaning services In addition, in Icehouse, a lot of focus has been placed on database improve in Kilo. Kilo address these concerns, nova-network was not be deprecated in the Juno release. In addition, to a limited degree, patches to nova-network have again begin to be accepted, such as adding a per-network settings feature and SR-IOV support in Juno. Juno number of limitations (performance issues in some scenarios, only basic high availability of layer 3 systems) and provides many more features than option for the next 12 months. migration path is released. Current thinking is that upgrades without instance downtime will be available in the Kilo release.
Distributed Virtual Router One of the long-time complaints surrounding OpenStack Networking was the lack of high availability for the layer 3 components. The Juno release introduced Distributed Virtual Router (DVR), which aims to solve this problem. Early indications are that it does do this well for a base set of scenarios, such as using the ML2 plug-in with Open vSwitch, one flat external network and VXLAN tenant networks. However, it does appear that there are problems with the use of VLANs, IPv6, Floating IPs, high north-south traffic scenarios and large numbers of compute nodes. It is expected these will improve significantly with the Kilo release, but bug reports on specific issues are highly desirable.
New API Versions discussions indicate that the V2 API will remain for many releases, and the next iteration of the API will be denoted v2.1 and have similar properties to the existing v2.0, rather than an entirely new v3 API. This is a great time to evaluate all API and provide comments while the next generation APIs are being defined. A new working group was formed specifically to improve OpenStack APIs and create design guidelines, which you are welcome to join. Kilo greenfield deployments, though according to the latest user survey results it remains to see widespread uptake. The bare-metal deployment has been widely lauded, and development continues. The Juno release brought the Ironic drive into the Compute project, and it is aimed to deprecate the existing bare-metal driver in Kilo. If you are a current user of the bare metal driver, a particular blueprint to follow is Deprecate the Baremetal driver. Kilo development for some time, and we saw the first integrated release of it in Icehouse. From release it was able to deploy database servers out of the box in a highly available way, initially supporting only MySQL. Juno introduced support for Mongo (including clustering), Posgres and Couchbase, in addition to replication functionality for MySQL. In Kilo, more advanced clustering capability is expected, in addition to better integration with other OpenStack components such as networking. Juno
Messaging as a Service (Zaqar) role="keep-together">Kilo.
DNS as a Service (Designate) A long requested service, to provide the ability to manipulate DNS entries associated with OpenStack resources has gathered a following. The Designate project has entered “incubation,” meaning if the upcoming development cycles are successful, it could be released in Kilo.
underwent significant improvement, while in Icehouse it was the scheduler in Block Storage that received a boost. Further down the track, an effort will come to fruition. Some of this work for Kilo can be found under the Gantt project. Kilo Block Storage is now considered a stable project, with wide uptake and a long track record of quality drivers. The team still discussed many areas of work at the Kilo summit, including better error reporting, automated dicovery, and thin provisioning features.
deleted_lines:
the Icehouse release and perhaps further afield. Icehouse Juno Under development xlink:href="https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ReleaseNotes/Icehouse">2014.1 Apr 17, 2014 Icehouse Current stable release, security-supported Havana Security-supported Grizzly EOL Community-supported Community-supported Rough-draft design Havana), internal messaging communication is versioned, meaning services In addition, a lot of focus has been placed on database improve in Icehouse. Icehouse address these concerns, nova-network will not be deprecated in the Icehouse release. In addition, the Program Technical Lead of the Compute project has indicated that, to a limited degree, patches to nova-network will now again begin to be accepted. Icehouse number of limitations (IPv6 support, performance issues in some scenarios) and provides many more features than option for the next 12 to 18 months. migration path is released. If you must upgrade, please be aware that both service and instance downtime is likely unavoidable.
Compute V3 API discussions indicate that the V2 API will remain for many releases, but this is a great time to evaluate the Compute API and provide comments while it is being defined. Of particular note is the decision that the V3 API will not support XML messages—being JSON only. This was based on the poor testing of existing XML responses in the V2 API and the lack of effort to continue to develop and maintain an entire second response type. Feedback on this and any such change is welcome by responding to the user survey. Icehouse greenfield deployments. Though bare-metal deployment has been widely lauded, and development continues, the project to replace the Compute bare-metal driver will not graduate in Icehouse. A particular blueprint to follow is Migration Path from Nova's BM Driver, which tracks the ability to move to the new project from an existing bare-metal deployment. Icehouse development for some time, and we will finally see the first integrated release of it in Icehouse. Initially, it will only support MySQL, with further options available in Juno onward, but it should be able to deploy database servers out of the box in a highly available way from this release. Icehouse
Messaging as a Service (Marconi) role="keep-together">Juno. underwent significant improvement, while in Icehouse the scheduler in Block Storage is slated for a boost. Further down the track, an effort will come to fruition. Icehouse The team discussed many areas of work at the Icehouse summit, including volume migration support, Ceph integration, and access control for volumes.

commit_message:
Fix idempotency of cs_resource

* insync? to drop status metadata from checks
* code cleanup
* fix rspec for cs_resource type
* switch location add implementation from pcs
  to cibadmin --patch to solve problems with
  cib changes not being synced to other nodes

related-blueprint: pacemaker-improvements
Related-Bug: 1391599

commit_message:
labs: fix Windows batch file creation

This changeset reverts "labs: temporary wbatch fix" and replaces it with
a proper fix, allowing the creation of correct Windows batch files on
build hosts without VirtualBox.

Change-Id: Iad005ce9f0dcecb910fc09b2c43385dd42992eda

removed extra spaces

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/training-guides refs/changes/36/122536/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: The Technical Committee ("TC") is tasked with providing the technical leadership for OpenStack as a whole and the official programs, as defined below. It enforces OpenStack ideals (Openness, Transparency, Commonality, Integration, Quality), decides on issues affecting multiple programs, forms an ultimate appeals board for technical decisions, and generally has oversight over the OpenStack project entirely. ‘OpenStack "Programs" are efforts which are essential to the completion of the OpenStack project mission. This mission is to produce the ubiquitous open source cloud computing platform that will meet the needs of public and private clouds regardless of size, by being simple to implement and massively scalable. Programs can create any code repository and produce any deliverable they deem necessary to achieve their goals.`- Manage day-to-day operations - Drive the program goals - Resolve technical disputes`The TC seats are elected by the Active Technical Contributors ("ATC"), which are a subset of the Foundation Individual Members. Individual Members who committed a change to a repository under any of the official OpenStack programs (as defined above) over the last two 6-month release cycles are automatically considered an ATC.`- Bug fixers, technical documentation writers can exceptionally apply for ATC`Each APC/ATC in the class should add a URL to the etherpad proving it`
deleted_lines: The Technical Committee ("TC") is tasked with providing the technical leadership for OpenStack as a whole (all official programs, as defined below). It enforces OpenStack ideals (Openness, Transparency, Commonality, Integration, Quality...), decides on issues affecting multiple programs, forms an ultimate appeals board for technical decisions, and generally has oversight over all the OpenStack project. `OpenStack "Programs" are efforts which are essential to the completion of the OpenStack project mission, which is to produce the ubiquitous Open Source Cloud Computing platform that will meet the needs of public and private clouds regardless of size, by being simple to implement and massively scalable. Programs can create any code repository and produce any deliverable they deem necessary to achieve their goals.`- manage day-to-day operations - drive the program goals - resolve technical disputes`The TC seats are elected by the Active Technical Contributors ("ATC"), which are a subset of the Foundation Individual Members. Individual Members who committed a change to a repository under any of the official OpenStack programs (as defined above) over the last two 6-month release cycles are automatically considered ATC.`- Bug triagers, technical documentation writers, etc can exceptionally apply for ATC`Each APC / ATC in the class add a URL to the etherpad proving it`

commit_message:
PureISCSIDriver needs to disconnect hosts before deleting volumes.

Some error conditions can cause a situation where the volume is
“connected” to a Purity host, but the volume failed to attach on the
initiator side. If we then try to delete this volume it will cause
errors and leave orphaned volumes behind on the Flash Array.

The solution is to check for any connections and then remove them prior
to making a call to delete the volume.

Closes-Bug: 1388260
Change-Id: I8f5b3b28900d79228fd91f2ad53535224f263657

commit_message:
Introudce benchmark.context() decorator

Before this patch we have to specify:

__ctx_name__, __ctx_order__ and __ctx_hidden__ by hands as attributes
of context class.

This thing produced few issues:

1) It looks ugly
2) It is absolutelly unclear. So you don't know what they mean, and
   there is no easy way to find information about it. So now it's
   much simpler e.g. you should just take a look at decorator
   implementation
3) This was source of bugs, cause it was not tested by syntax
   of language => so we have to have mad tests to check that
   all __ctx_name__, __ctx_order__ were specified

* Use decorator instead of direct setting attributes

* Rename attributes:
  __ctx_name__ -> _ctx_name
  __ctx_order__ -> _ctx_order
  __ctx_hidden__ -> _ctx_hidden

  This was done cause of unification with other parts of code

* Improve a bit "servers" get uuid of image and flavor only once

* Impove order of context

* Make secgroup and allow_ssh not hidden context. There is no
  need to hide them, and probably somebody would like to use
  them.

* Docs are updated

Change-Id: Ib089b398ba0c7f54d5246eb6ba29f5bbcfd2deee
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/02/137502/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @base.context(name="users", order=100) ctx_name=self.get_name(), ctx_name=self.get_name(),
deleted_lines: __ctx_name__ = "users" __ctx_order__ = 100 __ctx_hidden__ = False ctx_name=self.__ctx_name__, ctx_name=self.__ctx_name__,

commit_message:
Recompiling Mellanox OFED drivers on Ubuntu nodes using dkms

Recompilation is needed since the drivers are compiled and
installed during Ubuntu installation on one kernel, but are
later used on a different kernel version.

Change-Id: I1fc4b7bf5603991a302e3ef145be57dd2f36e693
Closes-bug: 1396020
Signed-off-by: gilmeir <gilmeir@mellanox.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/21/137421/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if ($::mellanox_mode != 'disabled') { class { 'mellanox_openstack::ofed_recompile' : } }

commit_message:
Reject object names with Unicode surrogates

Technically, you can't encode surrogates into UTF-8 at all, but Python
2 lets you get away with it. Python 3 does not.

We already have a check for surrogate pairs (commit 0080337), but not
one for lone surrogates. This commit forbids object names with lone
surrogates in them.

The problem with surrogates is trivially reproducible:

    swift@saio:~$ python2.7
    Python 2.7.3 (default, Feb 27 2014, 19:58:35)
    [GCC 4.6.3] on linux2
    Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
    >>> b'\xed\xa0\xbc'.decode('utf-8')
    u'\ud83c'
    >>>

    swift@saio:~$ python3.3
    Python 3.3.5 (default, Aug  4 2014, 15:27:24)
    [GCC 4.6.3] on linux
    Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
    >>> b'\xed\xa0\xbc'.decode('utf-8')
    Traceback (most recent call last):
      File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
    UnicodeDecodeError: 'utf-8' codec can't decode byte 0xed in position 0: invalid continuation byte
    >>>

See also http://bugs.python.org/issue9133

Change-Id: I7c31022e8a028c3cdf2ed1586349509d96cfded9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/15/133315/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: decoded = string.decode('UTF-8') if decoded.encode('UTF-8') != string: return False # A UTF-8 string with surrogates in it is invalid. if any(0xD800 <= ord(codepoint) <= 0xDFFF for codepoint in decoded):
deleted_lines: if string.decode('UTF-8').encode('UTF-8') != string:

commit_message:
Migrate to oslo.utils

The following modules are removed:
  - excutils,
  - importutils,
  - network_utils,
  - strutils,
  - timeutils.

Closes-Bug: #1385355
Change-Id: I1f34f17f5dbf37032584008f27e65d4dc4d475f4

commit_message:
ubuntu: use kernel 3.13 (lts-trusty)

* packages/deb/debian-boot/01_mount_target_proc.sh: the linux-image
  pre-install script uses /proc/cpuinfo to query CPU features without
  checking if /proc has been mounted. This script mounts proc in /target
  before installing the kernel itself.

* packages/deb/debian-boot/initrd.mk: include the helper script for
  mounting /proc into initramfs.

* config.mk: use lts-trusty (Linux 3.13) kernel and the corresponding
  netboot variant (netboot-trusty) by default.

Change-Id: Id6a2578e36f5f303ffa05ed4d702b119964f62a4
Related-bug: #1390044
Related-bug: #1383641
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-main refs/changes/20/134520/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: UBUNTU_KERNEL_FLAVOR?=lts-trusty UBUNTU_NETBOOT_FLAVOR?=trusty-netboot
deleted_lines: UBUNTU_KERNEL_FLAVOR?=lts-saucy UBUNTU_NETBOOT_FLAVOR?=saucy-netboot

subject: Use in-tree openvswitch datapath module if the kernel is new enough
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-11-08 11:53:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library/commit/ab4954100cccb3164d3553a78f3dbc4c73ecf98f', 'message': "ubuntu: use linux-image-lts-trusy (Linux 3.13)

* deployment/puppet/cobbler/templates/scripts/mount_target_proc.sh:
  - The linux-image pre-install script uses /proc/cpuinfo to query CPU
    features without checking if /proc has been mounted. This script
    mounts proc in /target before installing the kernel itself.

* deployment/puppet/l23network/manifests/l2.pp:
  - Don't install out-of-tree openvswitch datapath module. The module
    shipped with Linux 3.13 supports both GRE and VXLAN tunneling and
    is good enough for neutron/OpenStack

* deployment/puppet/cobbler/templates/preseed/ubuntu-1204.preseed.erb:
  - Install linux-image-lts-trusty

Change-Id: Ic0f19bb451cb6a27ba4f17431810301414e711c3
Related-bug: #1390044
Related-bug: #1383641

"}, {'number': 9, 'created': '2014-11-19 13:08:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library/commit/ae9027caea3457ccdee9c534f96d21892c9dfacc', 'message': 'Use in-tree openvswitch datapath module if the kernel is new enough

The major part of the openvswitch datapath kernel module has been merged into
Linux 3.13. In particular both GRE and VXLAN tunnels are supported (which are
used by neutron). The out-of-tree module is no longer actively developed.
In particular, version 1.10 and 1.11 do not support kernel newer than 3.8
(although Debian maintainers made them work with kernels <= 3.11).

Therefore use the out-of-tree module only with old kernels (the ones older
than 3.13)

Change-Id: Ic0f19bb451cb6a27ba4f17431810301414e711c3
Related-bug: #1390044
Related-bug: #1383641

commit_message:
Use in-tree openvswitch datapath module if the kernel is new enough

The major part of the openvswitch datapath kernel module has been merged into
Linux 3.13. In particular both GRE and VXLAN tunnels are supported (which are
used by neutron). The out-of-tree module is no longer actively developed.
In particular, version 1.10 and 1.11 do not support kernel newer than 3.8
(although Debian maintainers made them work with kernels <= 3.11).

Therefore use the out-of-tree module only with old kernels (the ones older
than 3.13)

Change-Id: Ic0f19bb451cb6a27ba4f17431810301414e711c3
Related-bug: #1390044
Related-bug: #1383641

deleted_lines: package { 'openvswitch-datapath': name => 'openvswitch-datapath-lts-saucy-dkms' } Package['openvswitch-datapath'] -> Package['openvswitch-common'] ~> Service['openvswitch-service']

Add an element to create a bandersnatch pypi mirror. We can then
use this element to create ci mirrors local to each CI rack.

commit_message:
Remove py26 from tox

Sahara does not support Python 2.6 anymore starting Kilo, it's not even
mentionned in the classifiers. Remove the tox target too as it's now
useless.

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-11-27 17:17:25.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/alarm/service.py', 'ceilometer/central/plugin.py', 'ceilometer/tests/alarm/evaluator/test_threshold.py', 'ceilometer/central/manager.py', 'ceilometer/energy/kwapi.py', 'ceilometer/nova_client.py', 'ceilometer/service.py', 'ceilometer/alarm/evaluator/__init__.py', 'ceilometer/image/glance.py', 'ceilometer/neutron_client.py', 'ceilometer/tests/alarm/test_singleton_alarm_svc.py', 'ceilometer/tests/alarm/test_alarm_svc.py', 'ceilometer/network/statistics/opencontrail/client.py', 'ceilometer/alarm/notifier/trust.py', 'ceilometer/network/statistics/opendaylight/client.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer/commit/638c66c889caef65873a9c4df5760583ad29ce3a', 'message': "Add timeout to all http requests

Currently, we generate lots of samples by polling data from other services,
but theses rest requests have no timeout limitation. We have observed that
some requests (for example, keystone due to openssl problem) may stuck for
over several days (maybe forever if we don't restart the service). Other
pollsters in same thread will not be able to work too. The worst thing is
that, when outside (keystone) service becomes normal, Ceilometer cannot
recover itself automatically, cloud operator needs to restart it manually.

So I strongly suggest that we should add timeout limit to **every** rest api
call, this is quite important to improve Ceilometer's robust and reliability.

This patch adds a new option named http_timeout, and applies it to almost
all http requests in Ceilometer project.

Change-Id: I76df2c0a9ffacb252e15edbb125e37ccb2aac4aa
Closes-Bug: #1388778
(cherry picked from commit bd0244ffe63b752649ae74f65a46563e986dcb00)

commit_message:
Add timeout to all http requests

Currently, we generate lots of samples by polling data from other services,
but theses rest requests have no timeout limitation. We have observed that
some requests (for example, keystone due to openssl problem) may stuck for
over several days (maybe forever if we don't restart the service). Other
pollsters in same thread will not be able to work too. The worst thing is
that, when outside (keystone) service becomes normal, Ceilometer cannot
recover itself automatically, cloud operator needs to restart it manually.

So I strongly suggest that we should add timeout limit to **every** rest api
call, this is quite important to improve Ceilometer's robust and reliability.

This patch adds a new option named http_timeout, and applies it to almost
all http requests in Ceilometer project.

Change-Id: I76df2c0a9ffacb252e15edbb125e37ccb2aac4aa
Closes-Bug: #1388778
(cherry picked from commit bd0244ffe63b752649ae74f65a46563e986dcb00)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/82/137682/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: CONF.import_opt('http_timeout', 'ceilometer.service') }, 'timeout': CONF.http_timeout,

commit_message:
Add upper bound to taskflow requirement

This adds an upper bound to taskflow so that the version
released in juno (0.5) is used and newer versions that will
be released in kilo (0.6) will not be picked up automatically.

This also seems to be aligned with placing upper bounds on
requirements in stable branches.

Change-Id: I1713b7f9c3a2b8e8fcc50d8ee22bec07412751ee

commit_message:
Add encoding to keys in compute_signature

Unlike fixed sample keys as counter_name and counter_volume,
metadata keys may contain unicode characters.
ceilometer.publisher.utils.compute_signature can't calculate
signature of unicode symbols and crashes.
In this patch encoding keys is added.

Change-Id: I94d02ce20999510e9c6aaf33f7ee503bbb350e87
Closes-bug: #1391517
(cherry picked from commit 05276690525d76e18769712bc66d0cd535b11f18)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/80/137680/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_verify_unicode_symbols(self): data = {u'a\xe9\u0437': 'A', 'b': u'B\xe9\u0437' } data['message_signature'] = utils.compute_signature( data, 'not-so-secret') jsondata = jsonutils.loads(jsonutils.dumps(data)) self.assertTrue(utils.verify_signature(jsondata, 'not-so-secret'))

commit_message:
Database.max_retries only override on sqlalchemy side

Currently, the max_retries parameter will be override in
get_connection_from_config function. But it will be used
later in safe_mongo_call function.

Since the override of max_retries only need on sqlalchemy
side, this patch move the override from get_connection_
from_config to storage.impl_sqlalchemy.Connection.__init__
and make sure max_retries can be used on mongoDB side.

Change-Id: I83f35c886bc8b7299c1efd7297fdbc980214567f
Closes-Bug: #1395972
(cherry picked from commit afb90e0cfc7fadae17ed9d360124e5683cb0b99a)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/81/137681/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Set max_retries to 0, since oslo.db in certain cases may attempt # to retry making the db connection retried max_retries ^ 2 times # in failure case and db reconnection has already been implemented # in storage.__init__.get_connection_from_config function cfg.CONF.set_override('max_retries', 0, group='database')

commit_message:
Add a listener provided default poll() timeout

The kombu docs actually recommend that drain_events
by default have a 1 timeout, so to allow this to work
as well as to allow the poll() executor to use this
timeout set a variable that allows it to be used (for
non-amqp drivers the existing none timeout will be used
as before).

Change-Id: I01d0c478aa0fc159806909215f214fb2960cd079

commit_message:
Add regions module to integration tests

Regions module should contains basic functionality that should be
shared among multiple page objects: common tables, forms,
notifications etc.. Basically every piece of code that can be reused by
multiple classes in a form of a new object should be placed in here.

* I would suggest that already created regions should be moved into this
  module.

* I would consider region everything that can be reused by at least
  two page objects and aim for maximal code reusability in the future.

* Every new region should inherit from class BaseRegion located in
  baseregion.py.

Partially implements blueprint: selenium-integration-testing

Change-Id: Ib8c20d8833e0830c85030633091663d33de6e3ab

added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from openstack_dashboard.test.integration_tests import helpers class TestProjectComputeOverview(helpers.TestCase): """This test is more likely for verification that some basic regions functionality works as expected. """ def test_invalid_date(self): """Submiting invalid date should result in visibility of error message """ self.home_pg.date_form.query("2000-06-01", "1980-06-01") self.assertTrue(self.home_pg.error_message.is_present(), "Error message is not present eventhough" " submitted date was invalid.") def test_empty_action_table(self): """Usage table should be empty after submiting ridiculous date""" self.home_pg.date_form.query("2000-06-01", "2000-06-02") # no error message should not be displayed self.assertFalse(self.home_pg.error_message.is_present(), "Error message should not be visible.") self.assertFalse(self.home_pg.action_table.rows, "Table should be empty.") def test_table_data_save_to_csv_action(self): csv_btn = self.home_pg.action_table.actions[0] # not sure about the string comparsion ... action_name = "Download CSV Summary" self.assertEqual(action_name, csv_btn.text, "Action name should be: %s" % action_name)

commit_message:
Update DB migration tests in respect to new release of Alembic

After alembic update output of 'history' command in alembic changed.
This commit fixes failing unit tests.

Change-Id: I34b6c9e6593a49cbc1d674c81d4ad782a1715d65

deleted_lines: # The piece of output data with version can looked as: # 'Rev: 17738166b91 (head)' or 'Rev: 43b1a023dfaa' alembic_history = [r.split(' ')[1] for r in full_history.split("\n") if r.startswith("Rev")]

commit_message:
fpb shows incorrect message if task doesn't have timeout field

* oneOf/anyOf statement in jsonschema provides hard to
  understand message, in order to solve this problem was created
  base jsonschema for parameters where timeout is required
  field
* print error messages to stderr instead of stdout

Closes-bug: #1396234
Change-Id: I6dc6b8b77cdd4576a239303726ec42f69a1a0e73
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-plugins refs/changes/49/137149/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: error_msg = 'File "{0}", {1}'.format(path, exc.message) if value_path: error_msg = '{0}, {1}'.format( error_msg, 'value path "{0}"'.format(value_path)) raise errors.ValidationError(error_msg)
deleted_lines: raise errors.ValidationError( 'Wrong value format "{0}", for file "{1}", {2}'.format( value_path, path, exc.message))

commit_message:
Use environment file in template-validate

Use the -e parameter in template-validate to override any
Default values specified in the template.  This has the desirable
effect of making Horizon use parameters updated from the environment
file.

Change-Id: I84405d1d2f5245ab7cb8b909c2ea1407d5b2973e
Closes-Bug: #1388985
(cherry picked from commit 09bc7ad79e4d95cffd8db19c781dc66230640d84)

deleted_lines: tmpl_params = tmpl.parameters(None, {})

commit_message:
Switch add location implementation to cibadmin

* In can fix problems with location adds not being synced

Change-Id: I6d25f9120323fc97438fb50089abd27c129606ab
Related-Bug: 1396481
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/55/137655/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: xml = <<-EOF <diff> <diff-added> <cib> <configuration> <constraints> <rsc_location id="#{id}" node="#{node}" rsc="#{primitive}" score="#{score}"/> </constraints> </configuration> </cib> </diff-added> </diff> EOF cibadmin '--patch', '--sync-call', '--xml-text', xml
deleted_lines: retry_command { pcs 'constraint', 'location', 'add', id, primitive, node, score }

details), let's disable the tests for now and reenable them shortly as

commit_message:
Temporarily disable the Jasmine unit tests

A recent Jasmine package upgrade to move to Jasmine 2.x is breaking the
Horizon gate. There is other work underway to make Horizon more
compatible with Jasmine 2.x (see comment #2 in the bug for more
details), let's disable the tests for now and reenable them shortly as
part of that other work when we can make sure the upgrade to 2.x
happens when the test codebase is ready to handle it.

Change-Id: I745e8957128772a7415a20393940068dbd89a493
Closes-Bug: #1396954
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/14/137614/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from django.utils import unittest @unittest.skip("Temporarily disabled, see bug #1396954")

commit_message:
Qpid: explicitly name subscription queue

This ensures that on reconnect the same queue is used rather than
leaving it abandoned but still bound with the same routing key that will
be used with the new queue.

Note: the fix is not relevant for Juno since Neutron uses oslo.messaging
since then which already includes the fix.

Change-Id: Ib76371a3b649688df395d7bf07f813a837b2313a
Closes-Bug: 1318742

commit_message:
Use save_and_reraise in drivers/netapp

Handle exception that needs to be reraised using
save_and_reraise context manager.
Made due to Kilo stabilization work:
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/cinder-kilo-stabilisation-work

Change-Id: Ifd36bb32f8b3b2bb5cb4176fcce24e3c37724af8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/31/131731/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception(reraise=False) as cxt: code = e.code message = e.message msg = _('Error mapping lun. Code :%(code)s,' ' Message:%(message)s') msg_fmt = {'code': code, 'message': message} LOG.warn(msg % msg_fmt) (igroup, lun_id) = self._find_mapped_lun_igroup(path, initiator) if lun_id is not None: return lun_id else: cxt.reraise = True with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception(reraise=False) as cxt: msg = _("Error unmapping lun. Code :%(code)s," " Message:%(message)s") msg_fmt = {'code': e.code, 'message': e.message} LOG.warn(msg % msg_fmt) # if the lun is already unmapped if e.code == '13115' or e.code == '9016': pass else: cxt.reraise = True
deleted_lines: import sys code = e.code message = e.message msg = _('Error mapping lun. Code :%(code)s, Message:%(message)s') msg_fmt = {'code': code, 'message': message} exc_info = sys.exc_info() LOG.warn(msg % msg_fmt) (igroup, lun_id) = self._find_mapped_lun_igroup(path, initiator) if lun_id is not None: return lun_id else: raise exc_info[0], exc_info[1], exc_info[2] msg = _("Error unmapping lun. Code :%(code)s," " Message:%(message)s") msg_fmt = {'code': e.code, 'message': e.message} exc_info = sys.exc_info() LOG.warn(msg % msg_fmt) # if the lun is already unmapped if e.code == '13115' or e.code == '9016': pass else: raise exc_info[0], exc_info[1], exc_info[2]

commit_message:
Use save_and_reraise in drivers/hitachi

Handle exception that needs to be reraised using
save_and_reraise context manager.
Made due to Kilo stabilization work:

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/12/131712/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from cinder.openstack.common import excutils with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception(reraise=False) as cxt: if (re.search('DMER0300B8', ex.stderr) or re.search('DMER0800CF', ex.stderr) or re.search('DMER0800D[0-6D]', ex.stderr) or re.search('DMER03006A', ex.stderr) or re.search('DMER030080', ex.stderr)): msg = basic_lib.output_err(615, copy_method=method, pvol=pvol) raise exception.HBSDBusy(message=msg) else: cxt.reraise = True
deleted_lines: if (re.search('DMER0300B8', ex.stderr) or re.search('DMER0800CF', ex.stderr) or re.search('DMER0800D[0-6D]', ex.stderr) or re.search('DMER03006A', ex.stderr) or re.search('DMER030080', ex.stderr)): msg = basic_lib.output_err(615, copy_method=method, pvol=pvol) raise exception.HBSDBusy(message=msg) else: raise

commit_message:
Use save_and_reraise in drivers/nexenta

Handle exception that needs to be reraised using
save_and_reraise context manager.
Made due to Kilo stabilization work:
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/cinder-kilo-stabilisation-work

Change-Id: If4e08739bcd99b4c032a0ab5d0a1f255a62cc946
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/22/131722/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from cinder.openstack.common import excutils with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception(reraise=False) as cxt: if 'does not exist' in exc.args[0]: LOG.info( _('Volume %s does not exist, it seems it was already ' 'deleted.'), volume_name) return if 'zvol has children' in exc.args[0]: raise exception.VolumeIsBusy(volume_name=volume_name) cxt.reraise = True with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception(reraise=False) as cxt: LOG.error( _('Volume creation failed, deleting created snapshot ' '%(volume_name)s@%(name)s'), snapshot) try: self.delete_snapshot(snapshot) except (nexenta.NexentaException, exception.SnapshotIsBusy): LOG.warning(_('Failed to delete zfs snapshot ' '%(volume_name)s@%(name)s'), snapshot) cxt.reraise = True with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception(reraise=False) as cxt: if "does not exist" in exc.args[0]: LOG.info(_('Snapshot %s does not exist, it seems it was ' 'already deleted.'), snapshot_name) return if "snapshot has dependent clones" in exc.args[0]: raise exception.SnapshotIsBusy( snapshot_name=snapshot['name']) cxt.reraise = True with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception(reraise=False) as cxt: if ensure and 'already configured' in exc.args[0]: LOG.info(_('Ignored target creation error "%s" while ' 'ensuring export'), exc) else: cxt.reraise = True with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception(reraise=False) as cxt: if ((ensure and 'already exists' in exc.args[0]) or 'target must be offline' in exc.args[0]): LOG.info(_('Ignored target group creation error "%s" ' 'while ensuring export'), exc) else: cxt.reraise = True with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception(reraise=False) as cxt: if ((ensure and 'already exists' in exc.args[0]) or 'target must be offline' in exc.args[0]): LOG.info( _('Ignored target group member addition error ' '"%s" while ensuring export'), exc) else: cxt.reraise = True with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception(reraise=False) as cxt: if not ensure or 'in use' not in exc.args[0]: cxt.reraise = True with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception(reraise=False) as cxt: if not ensure or 'view entry exists' not in exc.args[0]: cxt.reraise = True else: LOG.info( _('Ignored LUN mapping entry addition error "%s" ' 'while ensuring export'), exc)
deleted_lines: if 'does not exist' in exc.args[0]: LOG.info(_('Volume %s does not exist, it seems it was already ' 'deleted.'), volume_name) return if 'zvol has children' in exc.args[0]: raise exception.VolumeIsBusy(volume_name=volume_name) raise LOG.error(_('Volume creation failed, deleting created snapshot ' '%(volume_name)s@%(name)s'), snapshot) try: self.delete_snapshot(snapshot) except (nexenta.NexentaException, exception.SnapshotIsBusy): LOG.warning(_('Failed to delete zfs snapshot ' '%(volume_name)s@%(name)s'), snapshot) raise if "does not exist" in exc.args[0]: LOG.info(_('Snapshot %s does not exist, it seems it was ' 'already deleted.'), snapshot_name) return if "snapshot has dependent clones" in exc.args[0]: raise exception.SnapshotIsBusy(snapshot_name=snapshot['name']) raise if ensure and 'already configured' in exc.args[0]: LOG.info(_('Ignored target creation error "%s" while ' 'ensuring export'), exc) else: raise if ((ensure and 'already exists' in exc.args[0]) or 'target must be offline' in exc.args[0]): LOG.info(_('Ignored target group creation error "%s" ' 'while ensuring export'), exc) else: raise if ((ensure and 'already exists' in exc.args[0]) or 'target must be offline' in exc.args[0]): LOG.info(_('Ignored target group member addition error ' '"%s" while ensuring export'), exc) else: raise if not ensure or 'in use' not in exc.args[0]: raise if not ensure or 'view entry exists' not in exc.args[0]: raise LOG.info(_('Ignored LUN mapping entry addition error "%s" ' 'while ensuring export'), exc)

commit_message:
Use save_and_reraise in drivers/emc

Handle exception that needs to be reraised using
save_and_reraise context manager.
Made due to Kilo stabilization work:
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/cinder-kilo-stabilisation-work

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/97/131997/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: except exception.VolumeBackendAPIException: with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception(): msg = (_('Command to create the temporary Volume %s failed') % dest_volume_name) LOG.error(msg) with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception(reraise=False) as cxt: if ex.out.find("Storage Group name already in use") == -1: cxt.reraise = True with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception(reraise=False) as cxt: if ex.rc == 83: # SG was not created or was destroyed by another concurrent # operation before connected. # Create SG and try to connect again LOG.warn(_('Storage Group %s is not found. Create it.'), storage_group) self.assure_storage_group(storage_group) self._client.connect_host_to_storage_group( hostname, storage_group) else: cxt.reraise = True with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception(reraise=False) as cxt: if ex.rc != 83: cxt.reraise = True
deleted_lines: except exception.VolumeBackendAPIException as ex: msg = (_('Command to create the temporary Volume %s failed') % dest_volume_name) LOG.error(msg) raise ex if ex.out.find("Storage Group name already in use") == -1: raise ex if ex.rc == 83: # SG was not created or was destroyed by another concurrent # operation before connected. # Create SG and try to connect again LOG.warn(_('Storage Group %s is not found. Create it.'), storage_group) self.assure_storage_group(storage_group) self._client.connect_host_to_storage_group( hostname, storage_group) else: raise ex if ex.rc != 83: raise ex

commit_message:
Use save_and_reraise in drivers/san/hp

Handle exception that needs to be reraised using
save_and_reraise context manager.
Made due to Kilo stabilization work:
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/cinder-kilo-stabilisation-work

Change-Id: Id495c233245eb318891e8983a7ce328f02afabf5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/99/131399/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception(): LOG.error(ex) except exception.CinderException as ex: with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception(): LOG.error(ex) with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception(reraise=False) as cxt: if ex.get_code() == 29: if self.client.isOnlinePhysicalCopy(volume_name): LOG.debug("Found an online copy for %(volume)s" % {'volume': volume_name}) # the volume is in process of being cloned. # stopOnlinePhysicalCopy will also delete # the volume once it stops the copy. self.client.stopOnlinePhysicalCopy(volume_name) else: LOG.error(ex) cxt.reraise = True cxt.reraise = True with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception(reraise=False) as cxt: if 'host does not exist' in e.get_description(): # use the wwn to see if we can find the hostname hostname = self._get_3par_hostname_from_wwn_iqn(wwn, iqn) # no 3par host, re-throw if (hostname is None): LOG.error(e) cxt.reraise = True else: # not a 'host does not exist' # HTTPNotFound exception, re-throw cxt.reraise = True with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception(reraise=False) as cxt: if ex.get_code() == 40 and "keepVV" in str(ex): # Cannot retype with snapshots because we don't want to # use keepVV and have straggling volumes. # Log additional info and then raise. LOG.info(_("tunevv failed because the volume '%s' " "has snapshots.") % volume_name) cxt.reraise = True with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception(reraise=False) as cxt: # HTTPNotFound(code=102) is OK. Set does not exist. if ex.get_code() != 102: LOG.error( _("Unexpected error when retype() tried to " "deleteVolumeSet(%s)") % vvs_name) cxt.reraise = True
deleted_lines: LOG.error(ex) raise ex except exception.CinderException as ex: LOG.error(ex) raise ex if ex.get_code() == 29: if self.client.isOnlinePhysicalCopy(volume_name): LOG.debug("Found an online copy for %(volume)s" % {'volume': volume_name}) # the volume is in process of being cloned. # stopOnlinePhysicalCopy will also delete # the volume once it stops the copy. self.client.stopOnlinePhysicalCopy(volume_name) raise ex else: LOG.error(ex) raise ex if 'host does not exist' in e.get_description(): # use the wwn to see if we can find the hostname hostname = self._get_3par_hostname_from_wwn_iqn(wwn, iqn) # no 3par host, re-throw if (hostname is None): raise else: # not a 'host does not exist' HTTPNotFound exception, re-throw LOG.error(e) raise if ex.get_code() == 40 and "keepVV" in str(ex): # Cannot retype with snapshots because we don't want to # use keepVV and have straggling volumes. Log additional # info and then raise. LOG.info(_("tunevv failed because the volume '%s' " "has snapshots.") % volume_name) raise ex # HTTPNotFound(code=102) is OK. Set does not exist. if ex.get_code() != 102: LOG.error( _("Unexpected error when retype() tried to " "deleteVolumeSet(%s)") % vvs_name) raise ex

commit_message:
Allows to filter out the gnocchi generated samples

This is a lossy way to protect gnocchi to automatically DDoS
itself when it write data to swift and ceilometer monitor swift
resources.

Change-Id: Ic91e1715ed56d7cb5962c216aa3c7ba8ab0dbbff
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/gnocchi refs/changes/22/128922/17 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cfg.StrOpt('project_id', default="<uuid>", help='Gnocchi project id, used to filter out samples ' 'generated by Gnocchi'), self.gnocchi_project_id = conf.dispatcher_gnocchi.project_id # NOTE(sileht): project_id/user_id are mandatory for gnocchi # but for example storage.api.request don't have that one # we also skip sample generated by gnocchi itself data = [s for s in data if (s['project_id'] and s['user_id'] and (not self.gnocchi_project_id or s['project_id'] != self.gnocchi_project_id))]
deleted_lines: if not samples[-1]['project_id'] or not samples[-1]['project_id']: LOG.debug("Get resource without project_id/user_id: %s" % samples) # NOTE(sileht): project_id/user_id are mandatory for gnocchi # but for example storage.api.request don't have that one return

commit_message:
Add a gnocchi dispatcher for ceilometer

This introduces a new dispatcher for Gnocchi that is able to
transform and publish the Ceilometer samples to Gnocchi.

Co-Authored-by: Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info>

Change-Id: I424b991075ddc6ca7ef6bd7c6d17db247bf90c83
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/gnocchi refs/changes/98/98798/28 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ceilometer.dispatcher = gnocchi = gnocchi.ceilometer:GnocchiDispatcher

commit_message:
Change role to cinder

We slightly miss that fact than cinder should connect to GlusterFS
from node which hosts openstack-cinder-volume service. In our case
it is not controller, but cinder node. So, we just change that role
in tasks.yaml.

Change-Id: Idb055b34e394154bfb2fe1f24ec28edb8a320450
Closes-Bug: #1396996

commit_message:
Bump glance_store to 0.1.9

There is an bug in glance_store https://bugs.launchpad.net/glance/+bug/1371040
which breaks glance using rbd driver, this patch updates glance_store
to >= 0.1.9 which fixes that issue.

(cherry picked from commit 99e31d4c9bd01f678c0f387c61d3ab4ae63c2fcb)
Change-Id: I487e1b3b22e6ecbb04ff99a81f098e72e17cd842

deleted_lines: glance_store>=0.1.1 # Apache-2.0

commit_message:
rest: remove Carbonara exception leak

Replace the NoDeloreanAvailable exception from Carbonara from a custome
one in storage so all drivers can use it, even without using Carbonara.

Also improve the error reporting with the actual timestamp being too
old.

Change-Id: I588b215236de93e080be61f92cfabe807d6f7915

commit_message:
rest, indexer: store creators of the resources

This patch adds storing the user/project who created the resource. This
is going to be needed in order to allow finer-grained rules in the
policy. It will for example disallow create/update/delete operations on
resources/entities that were created by an admin on behalf of a user.

Change-Id: I6916e0d5da2115ea496141e69ceb39d861fa92ae

commit_message:
unconfigured clients look in the [clients] section for defaults

This change enables clients that have no specific settings in
the [clients_xxx] sections of the configuration file to get defaults
from the [clients] section.

Change-Id: I071bd77a2e1f0ad366b80c095917a8debc5cef2b
Closes-Bug: 1379958

commit_message:
Prepare for documentation of Resources

Add a section for where Resource classes will show up in the docs and
enter two skeleton pages for how this will look. Later changes will
cover the actual member-level documentation of the Resource classes for
each service, along with their addition to the TOC.

This additionally sets autodoc_member_order globally to "bysource",
meaning it'll order the rendered member documentation in the order it
was written. The default of alphabetical order by what shows up in
__dir__ is not as helpful or as readable as how we've organized the code.

Change-Id: Ifcd7cd81ba55ecb429c50680a926d4f8a44ca9a3

commit_message:
Make ResourceGroup updates update nested stacks

When you update a ResourceGroup which contains a provider resource
any update only happens when the properties input to the provider
change.  Instead, always trigger an update, so we can respond to
changes to the provider template definitions which may occur.

For AutoScalingGroup, we may want something more sophisticated,
where instead of unconditionally recurising on update, the option
to instead use rolling updates to do batched replacemnt of nested
stacks is offered.  But for ResourceGroup (which is a simple
container resource), this behavior seems most appropriate.

Conflicts:
	heat/engine/resources/resource_group.py
	heat/tests/test_resource_group.py

Change-Id: I6e0e50c821a27a0a9fb16dbf186558da3632935d
Closes-Bug: #1389499
(cherry picked from commit ea7f0144215763b62d35f3ec9bc22bba69256e69)

added_lines: def test_update_nochange(self): """Test update with no properties change.""" resg = self._create_dummy_stack() self.assertEqual(2, len(resg.nested())) resource_names = [r.name for r in resg.nested().iter_resources()] self.assertEqual(['0', '1'], sorted(resource_names)) new_snip = copy.deepcopy(resg.t) scheduler.TaskRunner(resg.update, new_snip)() self.stack = resg.nested() self.assertEqual((resg.CREATE, resg.COMPLETE), resg.state) self.assertEqual((resg.CREATE, resg.COMPLETE), resg.nested().state) self.assertEqual(2, len(resg.nested())) resource_names = [r.name for r in resg.nested().iter_resources()] self.assertEqual(['0', '1'], sorted(resource_names)) def test_update_nochange_resource_needs_update(self): """Test update when the resource definition has changed.""" # Test the scenario when the ResourceGroup update happens without # any changed properties, this can happen if the definition of # a contained provider resource changes (files map changes), then # the group and underlying nested stack should end up updated. resg = self._create_dummy_stack() self.assertEqual(2, len(resg.nested())) resource_names = [r.name for r in resg.nested().iter_resources()] self.assertEqual(['0', '1'], sorted(resource_names)) new_snip = copy.deepcopy(resg.t) resg._needs_update = mock.Mock(return_value=True) scheduler.TaskRunner(resg.update, new_snip)() self.stack = resg.nested() self.assertEqual((resg.UPDATE, resg.COMPLETE), resg.state) self.assertEqual((resg.UPDATE, resg.COMPLETE), resg.nested().state) self.assertEqual(2, len(resg.nested())) resource_names = [r.name for r in resg.nested().iter_resources()] self.assertEqual(['0', '1'], sorted(resource_names))

commit_message:
ResourceGroup don't special-case zero count

Currently, when you specify an initial count of zero, we don't
create the nested stack.  Unfortunately this then means you can
never update it, which makes the group forever broken..

Instead, always create the stack on create, even if it's an empty
stack containing zero resources.  This allows subsequent updates
which move to a non-zero count to work as expected.

Change-Id: I494229fcf85a1c28428fa2925c060fc1f40f4f36
Closes-Bug: #1392796
(cherry picked from commit d73107bd35cadcad0b4933aec43ef0313b961a45)

commit_message:
Error code for creating duplicate floating_ip_bulk

Trying to create a floating_ip_bulk that already
exists gives HttpBadRequest error, but it should
raise HttpConflict as the user is conflicting the
already created floating_ip_bulk.
So updated the code to HttpConflict error.
Closes-Bug: #1374260

Change-Id: I8194f08e6f8d1922b7316d302837549b5c957ba9

commit_message:
context.elevated() should use copy.deepcopy()

Currently context.elevated is just doing a copy.copy(self).
This needs to be changed to use copy.deepcopy so that the
list reference is not shared between objects which leaves
the possibility of an admin role leak.

This fix changes context.elevated use copy.deepcopy.

Change-Id: I349c53ccbe9e02ad2a3e84ae897424db9785a170
Closes-bug: 1386932
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/61/136061/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: context = self.deepcopy()
deleted_lines: context = copy.copy(self)

commit_message:
Fix in nsx-mode compute node deployment

Moved call plugin_neutronnsx class from cases for controller and compute roles
to common case, because plugin_neutronnsx can handle different roles.

Change-Id: I3907fe9a6fec2e5b802f895ddc7d6c6e35d9a1a3
closes-bug: #1393497

commit_message:
Set Galera user password same as MySQL root

* Use MySQL root password for Galera state transfer user which is
randomly generated rather than static one

commit_message:
use built in HTMLParser instead of lxml

The last use of lxml beyond the xml clients was the dashboard
test. Instead of using lxml we should be able to do this with built in
HTMLParser.

commit_message:
Cisco: update_port should only invoke n1kv and not nexus plugin

Update port method should not invoke the nexus plugin when it is
not configured with n1kv plugin. This patch adds a condition to the
update_port method making sure that nexus plugin is invoked only
when it is configured in cisco_plugins.ini file. This bug is only
targeted for the stable/icehouse release since the nexus monolithic
plugin code has been removed from Juno release onwards.

Change-Id: I67f023e8610975d9636124e9f82336b5ab407c16
Closes-bug: #1387846

commit_message:
Add retries in case of Cobbler overloading

Offen if Cobbler run two big task in parallel
we got error based on Cobbler overloading.
If we wait and try request again, it will
process without problem. This change
implement such behavior.

Change-Id: I1e9774b9398dfb502159d7ba21e7e5b55b75b3a1
Closes-Bug: #1387699
Closes-Bug: #1396181
(cherry picked from commit 0bcc91185984a1f9e4bd68d9f247266c35349dae)

commit_message:
Drop RpcProxy usage from cisco apic ml2 plugin

Drop usage fo the RpcProxy compatibility class from the cisco apic ml2
plugin.  The equivalent oslo.messaging APIs are now used instead.

Part of blueprint drop-rpc-compat.

Change-Id: I415b65720a09652bae70fc1c1dada9f5727c4441

commit_message:
Fix issues with using the database

* Fix issue with 'database locked' in tests
* Fix issue with database thread safety

Change-Id: Ieffbc42a7767d0790e57461d564fccf68c0274db

commit_message:
Drop RpcProxy usage from oneconvergence plugin

This patch removes usage of the RpcProxy compatibility class from the
oneconvergence plugin.  The equivalent usage of oslo.messaging APIs is
now used intead.

Part of blueprint drop-rpc-compat.

Change-Id: Ifa74849ba9e3dc09cbb8cb3a723aeaa2b25b87ad

commit_message:
Add qpid and amqp 1.0 tox targets

This change adds two targets for qpid and amqp to
be able to run the functional tests suite on them in gate

This also run only functional tests for the functional tox testenv

Change-Id: Ibf1db3fe55f82dd6dc02f2e57d73608fcad80d0e

subject: Create a new connection when a process fork has been detected
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-11-15 01:12:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.messaging/commit/50aa7363d39e9b99662f7804e61c173bbf015c3d', 'message': "Use unique names for the container and reply link

This patch adds a unique name for the container's reply link, and
delays the creation of the container's name until a connection needs
to be created.  These changes should allow clients to perform a
process fork safely prior to initiating a connection to the messaging
service.

Change-Id: I5455cb0f8d380d6b65f1268b34a91355cbb14aa2
Closes-Bug: #1392868
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-11-27 02:28:05.000000000', 'files': ['oslo/messaging/_drivers/protocols/amqp/eventloop.py', 'oslo/messaging/_drivers/protocols/amqp/controller.py', 'oslo/messaging/_drivers/protocols/amqp/driver.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.messaging/commit/80e62aed7d63175079422bd6bb4578d45da7f30e', 'message': 'Create a new connection when a process fork has been detected

This patch attempts to deal with applications that have forked the
process after connecting to the broker.  First, the creation of the
connection is delayed until the application attempts to perform a
messaging operation.  Second, each time the application performs a
messaging operation the current process id is checked against the id
of the process that created the connection.  If the process ids do not
match, the application has called os.fork().  The new child process
discards the existing connection and creates a new one.

Change-Id: I5455cb0f8d380d6b65f1268b34a91355cbb14aa2
Closes-Bug: #1392868
'}]
commit_message:
Create a new connection when a process fork has been detected

This patch attempts to deal with applications that have forked the
process after connecting to the broker.  First, the creation of the
connection is delayed until the application attempts to perform a
messaging operation.  Second, each time the application performs a
messaging operation the current process id is checked against the id
of the process that created the connection.  If the process ids do not
match, the application has called os.fork().  The new child process
discards the existing connection and creates a new one.

Change-Id: I5455cb0f8d380d6b65f1268b34a91355cbb14aa2
Closes-Bug: #1392868

commit_message:
Adding unique identificators to Exceptions

implements bp: exceptions-improvement

Change-Id: I32db04687c9da29e601ee0615a4f370bec4d2e86
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara-specs refs/changes/60/136360/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================== Exceptions improvement ========================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/sahara/+spec/exceptions-improvement This specification proposes to add identificators for every raised Sahara exception, so it can be easily found in logs. Problem description =================== It would be nice to have an opportunity to find an exceptions in sahara logs by unique identificators. Proposed change =============== Support Features: * Every error that has been raised during the workflow will have, besides of error message, uuid property, whereby error can be found in logs easily. For example, NotFoundException will leave in logs: .. sourcecode:: console NotFoundException: Error ID: 7a229eda-f630-4153-be03-d71d6467f2f4. Object 'object' is not found .. Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Deployer impact --------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Sahara-image-elements impact ---------------------------- None Sahara-dashboard / Horizon impact --------------------------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: apavlov-n Other contributors: sreshetniak Work Items ---------- * Adding ability to generate unique identificators for SaharaException class * Change messages of Sahara exceptions so that all of them contain identificator. Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= None Documentation Impact ==================== None References ========== None

commit_message:
Notification listener pools

We can now set the pool name of a notification listener
to create multiple groups/pools of listeners consuming notifications
and that each group/pool only receives one copy of each notification.

The AMQP implementation of that is to set queue_name with the pool name.

Implements blueprint notification-listener-pools
Closes-bug: #1356226

Change-Id: I8dc0549f5550f684a261c78c58737b798fcdd656
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.messaging refs/changes/12/125112/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: server = messaging.get_notification_listener(transport, targets, endpoints) allow_requeue=False): allow_requeue)

subject: neutron port-list -f csv outputs poorly formatted JSON strings
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-06-13 12:47:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-neutronclient/commit/897ae2c80a395246ed3dc4eb3433ff8bfece0f4a', 'message': 'neutron port-list -f csv outputs poorly formatted JSON strings

Currently, if more than one IP is attached to a port, then the command "neutron port-list -f csv/table" displays the attached subnets in "fixed-ips" field as dictionaries in separate lines.

commit_message:
neutron port-list -f csv outputs poorly formatted
JSON strings

After the change, the attached subnets are displayed
as a list of dictionaries in one line only for csv
option.
It does not modify the output for tabular format.

Closes-Bug: #1263551

Change-Id: Ia34062562f0471bc926f9fc0bbed2d5dc4352dc0

deleted_lines: return '\n'.join([utils.dumps(ip) for ip in port['fixed_ips']])

commit_message:
Inspect the right memory from libvirt domain

Currently, memory usage from libvirt domain is inspected through
"available" or "unused" parameters which don't correct.

This patch change to get memory usage from "rss" paramater which
is the correct parameter return from libvirt domain.

Change-Id: I6d3723d853ce744e113cd03d1c2ba33877dac640
Closes-Bug: 1396928
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/56/137556/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: memory_stats.get('available') and memory_stats.get('unused')): memory_used = (memory_stats.get('available') - memory_stats.get('unused'))

commit_message:
Use response.text for returning unicode EC2 metadata

When serving meta-data that contains unicode, use the webob Response.text
instead of Response.body.  This also adds a test that triggers the bug in
addition to testing that all meta-data offered by the server can be served.

Closes-bug: #1380792

Change-Id: If2ddaa97bbc89cf574205c0327e3caa02dd503fc
(cherry picked from commit f0f07fdb6702f89f3800a5054e9365c3abc90f7a)

commit_message:
Fix exception handling in _get_host_metrics()

In resource_tracker.py, the exception path of _get_host_metrics()
misspells variable name 'monitor'. When exception occurs, this
misspelling prevents us to log warning message. This code change
corrects the misspelling.

Closes-Bug: 1394052

Conflicts:
        nova/tests/unit/compute/test_resource_tracker.py

Change-Id: I8a99a4ceb53c89038e8b292a15ad9fd20daa4233
(cherry picked from commit e09880dcd0f7ae766cae170c5b30fbabbe85eac3)

commit_message:
Adds skip flag for test_delete_external_networks_with_floating_ip

older releases unless backported.

commit_message:
Fix tempfile bugs from commit 6978275

Commit 6978275 changed xprofile middleware's usage of mktemp
and moved to using tempfile. But it was clearly never tested,
because the os.close() calls never worked. This patch updates
that previous patch to use a context to open and close the file.

Change-Id: I40ee42e8539551fd8e4dfb353f50146ab40a7847
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/82/137482/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: profile_img = tempfile.TemporaryFile() plt.savefig(profile_img, format='png', dpi=300) profile_img.seek(0) data = profile_img.read() os.close(profile_img) return data, [('content-type', 'image/jpg')]

commit_message:
Update glance_store dependency

Newer version of glance_store would be needed to fix swift multi-
tenant store in Glance.

This change would enable us to land
I14bb3c1fbc40ed2a81dc6990cfe59ae825733d1f for Glance stable/juno.

Adding cap to glance_store library as well.

(cherry picked from commit Icc44d7d1042cf3100b7375b782e7f5f8afdea872)
Change-Id: I1e064c95ff103a7d985d786e9834ef79af57d2e8

commit_message:
Use YAML text instead of JSON in HTTP body (client side)

 * Use YAML text instead of JSON for workbooks,
   workflows and actions in HTTP body.

Implements blueprint mistral-yaml-request-body

subject: Do not kill swift replicator services
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-11-26 17:53:26.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/swift/manifests/storage/generic.pp'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library/commit/48b969b0c33aa73f11fff4807a7d83e54f7b5aeb', 'message': 'Do not kill swift replicator services

To move from exec to SysV provider of the service
in previous releases we had to kill swift replicator
service with swift-init kill command.

This is not what we need in 6.0 release as we
are already managing everything with default OS
providers. Moreover, this commit is error-prone
for Ubuntu with upstart provider.

Change-Id: I9ed3a030b4987f919a9f9ec2d9351f0b2c3623b0
Closes-bug: #1384089
'}]
commit_message:
Do not kill swift replicator services

To move from exec to SysV provider of the service
in previous releases we had to kill swift replicator
service with swift-init kill command.

This is not what we need in 6.0 release as we
are already managing everything with default OS
providers. Moreover, this commit is error-prone
for Ubuntu with upstart provider.

Change-Id: I9ed3a030b4987f919a9f9ec2d9351f0b2c3623b0
Closes-bug: #1384089
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/28/137428/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: exec { "swift-init-kill-${name}-replicator" : command => "/usr/bin/swift-init kill ${name}-replicator", } Exec["swift-init-kill-${name}-replicator"] ~> Service["swift-${name}-replicator"]

commit_message:
Add `requests` to requirements

This library is used by default for all HTTP calls, so it should be in
requirements of ceilometerclient.
